verbose_text: Basal exogenous insulin therapy reduced the incidence of new-onset type 2 diabetes in patients with cardiovascular risk factors plus impaired fasting glucose or impaired glucose tolerance, but, to our knowledge, exogenous insulin is rarely used for type 2 diabetes prevention.
evidence: insulin therapy reduced the incidence of new-onset type 2 diabetes in patients with cardiovascular risk factors plus impaired fasting glucose or impaired glucose
